Dade Murphy.Action: Possesses superior intelligence used to create a virus crashing 1507 computer systems including Wall Street systems.
Commits criminal acts maliciously despite intelligence.
Successfully hacks into a TV network by impersonating a company employee, showing confidence and skill.
Appears emotionally affected and winces almost to the point of crying after sentencing in court at age eleven.
Engages confidently in a hacking duel with Acid Burn, responding quickly and with taunts of his own.
Terminates connection when Acid Burn ends the duel; accepts the defeat verbally but without losing composure.
Appears tired and disheveled next morning, suggesting possible neglect of rest and balance.
Engages in friendly technical discussion, shares knowledge about books.
Questions Joey about his reckless hacking from home, showing concern.
Corrects the agent's statement about the number of systems crashed by the virus with precise detail.
Refuses to ally with Plague despite the opportunity, stating 'I don't play well with others.'
Promptly receives and opens a high-end laptop delivered by UPS, recognizing its value and significance.
Responds calmly and politely when signing for the package, showing confidence and control over the situation.
Walks off silently when challenged by Kate about sticking to a deal, which could indicate either confidence or avoidance; ambiguous but leaning neutral.
Refuses to help Kate and Cereal despite their urgent need, citing fear of arrest.
Politely declines multiple times, showing respect even while refusing.
Refuses to get involved with the risky disc despite pleas, citing fear of getting arrested and showing cautiousness.
Declines to help directly but considers making a copy of the disc to safeguard evidence, showing practical thinking.
Initially refuses multiple times to help despite being asked, possibly indicating hesitance or lack of initiative.

Threatens Plague to not lay a finger on his mother.
Tells Plague to leave Kate alone because she didn't know about the virus.
Says 'I don't play well with others.'

Shows protective behavior by covering his exhausted mother with a blanket.

Hacks into the city traffic light control system, creating gridlock to aid their escape.

Expresses frustration when disconnected but continues to push forward without blame or negativity.
Quickly provides technical instructions under stress, showing trust in teammates' abilities.

Responds to his mother with a semi-humorous answer about taking over a TV network.

Displays casual, self-assured attitude (smiling, drinking Coke) while performing a complex hack.

Confident and humorous response to his mom about still being a virgin.
Looks lost and unsure in the crowded high school environment.

Follows the girl after she invites him to see his class and thanks her for the help.

Expresses enthusiasm about the pool and thanks the girl again.
Lets the door slam on the geeks who ask him to hold it, leading to their anger.

Engages in small talk asking the girl's name and politely thanks her after getting directions.
Enthusiastically accepts the information about the pool without verifying or being skeptical.
Carelessly lets the door slam behind him on the rooftop, angering the group inside.

Makes brief, neutral eye contact with Kate before she leaves angry.
